description: Command injection vulnerability found: HTTP request parameters are passed to the system function without sufficient validation. In function fcn.0000a6e8, parameters are formatted via snprintf and directly passed to the system function, which may lead to arbitrary command execution. Attackers can inject malicious commands by carefully crafting HTTP request parameters.

Detection of buffer overflow vulnerability: In the URL decoding function fcn.00009c40, the decoded string is copied back to the buffer via an insecure strcpy operation, potentially causing stack-based buffer overflow. This function is called by the HTTP parameter processing function fcn.0000998c, which handles external input.
